description:
Applies an atmospheric correction that converts top of atmosphere reflectance values into bottom of atmosphere/top of canopy reflectance values.
Note that multiple atmospheric methods exist, but may not be supported by all backends. The method parameter gives you the option of requiring a specific method, but this may result in an error if the backend does not support it.

parameters.description: input data cube containing multispectral optical top of atmosphere reflectances to be corrected
parameters.name: data

parameters.description:
The atmospheric correction method to use. Different backends can support different algorithms. Examples include FORCE, iCor.
Leave empty to allow the backend to choose, which will improve portability.
parameters.name: method

parameters.description: The name of the digital elevation model to use, leave empty to allow the backend to make a suitable choice. Not all backends may offer all digital elevation models.
parameters.name: elevation_model

UnsupportedParameter.message: One of the provided parameters is not supported by this backend. This can be resolved by using default parameters, or using a backend that supports the parameter value.

links.title: Atmospheric correction explained by EO4GEO body of knowledge.
